channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 24th September
item.description:
Constantly fly tipping. It used to be clean and inviting, now its constant dump site.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Lyndhurst Avenue, Friern Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose Pavings - Junction of Weston St. and St. Thomas' St., 24th September
item.description:
There are a couple of loose pavings near the junction of Weston St. and St. Thomas' St., SE1 (opposite the new sky scraper) that are a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Maze Pond, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously Loose Pavings, 24th September
item.description:
One of the tactile paving on the pedestrian crossing outside Leon on Tooley Street (More London) is dangerously loose, and I tripped on it and fell on my face as I passed by on the evening of Saturday 13th September at approximately 18:27. (My mobile phone also went flying out of my hand, and was lucky not to have cracked as it had a protective cover.) It has been like this for a while now, and needs to be fixed ASAP before someone is seriously hurt. Several of the other narrow paving slabs in the More London area are also dangerously loose and I have tripped on them in the past also (I have also witnessed other people tripping on them).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Overhanging vegetation on route to school is affecting kids from Clare House school as they make their way along the footpath., 23rd September
item.description:
I walk this way with my kids twice a day and often have to step into the footpath to avoid others as we make our way past the over hanging trees and vegetation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakwood Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
See above

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Forest Hill Road, Nunhead, London

item.title: The pavement is crooked and uneven, 23rd September
item.description:
I tripped on the crooked pavement and went face down on the concrete and smashed up my face and banged my teeth. I still have sore teeth and headaches. It happened at about 8pm on 10 September. I had to go to A&E and it was bleeding for two hours. I missed a day off work because I'd such a bad bang to my head.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Blaise Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
